member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Features.IHttpMinRequestBodyDataRateFeature
member.summary: Feature to set the minimum data rate at which the the request body must be sent by the client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Features.IHttpMinRequestBodyDataRateFeature.MinDataRate
member.summary: The minimum data rate in bytes/second at which the request body must be sent by the client. Setting this property to null indicates no minimum data rate should be enforced. This limit has no effect on upgraded connections which are always unlimited.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Features.IHttpMinResponseDataRateFeature
member.summary: Feature to set the minimum data rate at which the response must be received by the client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Features.IHttpMinResponseDataRateFeature.MinDataRate
member.summary: The minimum data rate in bytes/second at which the response must be received by the client. Setting this property to null indicates no minimum data rate should be enforced. This limit has no effect on upgraded connections which are always unlimited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.Frame.Abort(System.Exception)
member.summary: Immediate kill the connection and poison the request and response streams.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.Frame.ProcessRequestsAsync
member.summary: Primary loop which consumes socket input, parses it for protocol framing, and invokes the application delegate for as long as the socket is intended to remain open. The resulting Task from this loop is preserved in a field which is used when the server needs to drain and close all currently active connections.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.Frame`1.ProcessRequestsAsync
member.summary: Primary loop which consumes socket input, parses it for protocol framing, and invokes the application delegate for as long as the socket is intended to remain open. The resulting Task from this loop is preserved in a field which is used when the server needs to drain and close all currently active connections.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Infrastructure.HttpUtilities.GetKnownMethod(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Internal.System.Span{System.Byte},Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.HttpMethod@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Checks that up to 8 bytes from correspond to a known HTTP method.
member.remarks: A "known HTTP method" can be an HTTP method name defined in the HTTP/1.1 RFC. Since all of those fit in at most 8 bytes, they can be optimally looked up by reading those bytes as a long. Once in that format, it can be checked against the known method. The Known Methods (CONNECT, DELETE, GET, HEAD, PATCH, POST, PUT, OPTIONS, TRACE) are all less than 8 bytes and will be compared with the required space. A mask is used if the Known method is less than 8 bytes. To optimize performance the GET method will be checked first.
member.returns: true if the input matches a known string, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Infrastructure.HttpUtilities.GetKnownVersion(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Internal.System.Span{System.Byte},Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.HttpVersion@,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Checks 9 bytes from correspond to a known HTTP version.
member.remarks: A "known HTTP version" Is is either HTTP/1.0 or HTTP/1.1. Since those fit in 8 bytes, they can be optimally looked up by reading those bytes as a long. Once in that format, it can be checked against the known versions. The Known versions will be checked with the required '\r'. To optimize performance the HTTP/1.1 will be checked first.
member.returns: true if the input matches a known string, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Infrastructure.HttpUtilities.GetKnownVersion(System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks 9 bytes from correspond to a known HTTP version.
member.remarks: A "known HTTP version" Is is either HTTP/1.0 or HTTP/1.1. Since those fit in 8 bytes, they can be optimally looked up by reading those bytes as a long. Once in that format, it can be checked against the known versions. The Known versions will be checked with the required '\r'. To optimize performance the HTTP/1.1 will be checked first.
member.returns: true if the input matches a known string, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Infrastructure.HttpUtilities.GetKnownHttpScheme(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Internal.System.Span{System.Byte},Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.HttpScheme@)
member.summary: Checks 8 bytes from that correspond to 'http://' or 'https://'
member.param: A reference to the known scheme, if the input matches any
member.returns: True when memory starts with known http or https schema

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.MaxResponseBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the response buffer before write calls begin to block or return tasks that don't complete until the buffer size drops below the configured limit.
member.remarks: When set to null, the size of the response buffer is unlimited. When set to zero, all write calls will block or return tasks that don't complete until the entire response buffer is flushed. Defaults to 65,536 bytes (64 KB).

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.MaxRequestBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the request buffer.
member.remarks: When set to null, the size of the request buffer is unlimited. Defaults to 1,048,576 bytes (1 MB).

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.MaxRequestLineSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed size for the HTTP request line.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.MaxRequestHeadersTotalSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed size for the HTTP request headers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.MaxRequestHeaderCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed number of headers per HTTP request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.MaxRequestBodySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed size of any request body in bytes. When set to null, the maximum request body size is unlimited. This limit has no effect on upgraded connections which are always unlimited. This can be overridden per-request via .
member.remarks: Defaults to 30,000,000 bytes, which is approximately 28.6MB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.KeepAliveTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the keep-alive timeout.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.RequestHeadersTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time the server will spend receiving request headers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.MaxConcurrentConnections
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of open HTTP/S connections. When set to null, the number of connections is unlimited.

remarks.para: When a connection is upgraded to another protocol, such as WebSockets, its connection is counted against the limit instead of .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.MaxConcurrentUpgradedConnections
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of open, upgraded connections. When set to null, the number of upgraded connections is unlimited. An upgraded connection is one that has been switched from HTTP to another protocol, such as WebSockets.

remarks.para: When a connection is upgraded to another protocol, such as WebSockets, its connection is counted against the limit instead of .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.MinRequestBodyDataRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the request body minimum data rate in bytes/second. Setting this property to null indicates no minimum data rate should be enforced. This limit has no effect on upgraded connections which are always unlimited. This can be overridden per-request via .
member.remarks: Defaults to 240 bytes/second with a 5 second grace period.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.KestrelServerLimits.MinResponseDataRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the response minimum data rate in bytes/second. Setting this property to null indicates no minimum data rate should be enforced. This limit has no effect on upgraded connections which are always unlimited. This can be overridden per-request via .

remarks.para: Defaults to 240 bytes/second with a 5 second grace period.
Contrary to the request body minimum data rate, this rate applies to the response status line and headers as well.

This rate is enforced per write operation instead of being averaged over the life of the response. Whenever the server writes a chunk of data, a timer is set to the maximum of the grace period set in this property or the length of the write in bytes divided by the data rate (i.e. the maximum amount of time that write should take to complete with the specified data rate). The connection is aborted if the write has not completed by the time that timer expires.
